Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PGLa-H (chain of PYLa/PGLa A; Frogs, amphibians, animals)
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the gastrin/cholecystokinin family (Magainin subfamily)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.22014884]Gram-positive bacteria:Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC=8.7 µg/ml), Bacillus subtilis (MIC=14.4 µg/ml), Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) (MIC=67.8 µg/ml);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli ATCC 25922 (MIC=23.6 µg/ml)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.22014884]3.15% hemolytic activity at 100 μg/mL, 7.95% hemolytic activity at 200 μg/mL against rabbit red blood cells
Sequence Information.Function: PGLa-H display a broad-spectrum of antibacterial activity against a range of Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. PGLa-H shows moderate antibacterial activity against the multidrug-resistant methicillin-resistant S. aureus (MRSA) but exhibits hemolytic activity.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Expressed by the skin glands. Synthesized in the stomach and stored in a novel granular multinucleated cell in the gastric mucosa. Stored as active, processed peptides in large granules within the granular gland secretions of the skin.

Literature.Title: Isolation and characterisation of a new antimicrobial peptide from the skin of Xenopus laevis.
Literature.Author: Hou F, Li J, Pan P, Xu J, Liu L, Liu W, Song B, Li N, Wan J, Gao H.

Literature.Title: Antimicrobial peptides in the stomach of Xenopus laevis.
Literature.Author: Moore KS, Bevins CL, Brasseur MM, Tomassini N, Turner K, Eck H, Zasloff M.
